characters: TIS THE SEASON TO BE GNARLY.
AND OVER... WHEN HE SLAPPED ME THE PAIN WAS EXQUISITE..."
SCREAMING... WE WERE LIKE TWO ANIMALS... COMING TOGETHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A two-story California Craftsman with a SOLD sign in the front yard. Yukon SUV pulls into the drive and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver's door opens and DEREK CHARLES steps out, a handsome and likable African-American in his early 30's; guy who's fought hard to make himself a success in busine and life. Derek wears a business suit and the first thing does is cross the lawn to the SOLD sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a new homeowner's look of satisfaction, Derek grips SOLD sign and pulls it out of the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D erek looks over to where his pretty wife BETH is standi beside the SUV, holding their cute 2 year old son KYLE in arms. Beth shakes her head with amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOLD sign, now in pieces, burns brightly in the fireplace. The rest of the room is empty except for KYLE is nearby, asleep in his stroller. Derek and Beth's VOICE drift down from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is coming down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want people to think we put it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft chuckle) I don't know. I kind of like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please tell me you're joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Beth stare up at their own reflections in a hug ceiling mirror. The rest of the room is vacant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying, before we take it down... maybe we should try it out. (PLAYFUL) You know. Christen the new house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do you suggest we use for a bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we need a bed for when we've got a fine shag carpet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS) Because I'm gonna have fine shag carpet tattoos all over my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek puts his arms around her waist and pulls her close. Beth resists -- but only slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Don't you have to go to work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nuzzling her neck) Told `em I'd be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle? That boy wouldn't wake up if a nuclear bomb went off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not, but the movers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't be here for another hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth smiles, giving in. They look up at themselves in the mirror like naughty teenagers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, you are so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't THAT why you married me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they begin to kiss passionately...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distorted images of Derek and Beth in the mirror's reflection, naked bodies intertwined, making love on the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle continues to snooze in his stroller. Outside the window, a moving van arrives and BLOWS its horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, drowsing in Derek's arms.    They stir at the sound the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to stay?     Crack the whip on these guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Go to work and earn that promotion. Somebody's got to pay for all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a quick kiss and then Beth swings over to find clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Beth dresses, Derek stares up at himself.    He smiles satisfaction. Life is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OVERS bring in furniture, placing a big glass table in th dining room area below the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, Beth opens a box and removes family pictures. She arranges them with loving care on the mantle above the fi place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRAMED PHOTOS of Derek and Beth in their early dating day at their wedding, celebrating holidays, Beth pregnant, th birth of Kyle; photos illustrating the history of this ha family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture of Beth and Kyle smiling at him from the dash, De drives the freeway toward the skyscrapers of downtown. He listens to the stock and financial report. Then, switches over to CD and Gnarls Barkley's "Gone Daddy Gone" blares The two sides of Derek Charles.                        C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLING DOWN from a towering glass and steel office build as Derek's Yukon enters the parking garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and several others ride up from the parking garage. Derek scans the Business page of a folded newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he elevator stops on the ground floor, the door slides op and MORE PEOPLE get on. The doors shut and the car ascend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: t other floors, people get on and off until it's just Der and one other passenger: LISA SHERIDAN, balancing an arm load of thick files. She's in her mid-20's, white, beautiful, glasses and hair pulled back projecting an efficient, smart and sophisticated look; simple blouse an skirt, high heels, great legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa glances over at Derek, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gage/Bendix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek looks up from his paper with a distracted smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't help but notice we're both going to Seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   Gage/Bendix.   I work there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an appointment with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?   Do I look like a client?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasant laugh) W ell, I hate to shatter the illusion but I'm just a lowly temp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely surprised) You're a temp?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just here for the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you could have fooled me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa shifts on her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to think these heels were a big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek glances down at her shapely legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) I should have worn my track shoes. They've got me running all over town picking up these disclosure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when the pile in her arms slides south.       The fall to the floor and spread out in a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa LAUGHS and drops to her knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) God, I'm such a klutz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek bends down to help.     Their hands touch briefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. Happen to anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They straighten up, look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he door slides open, revealing the sleek and vast offices GAGE BENDIX, ALTERNATIVE ASSET MANAGEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.   I owe you one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS Derek through a warren of cubicles where S WORKERS attend phones and computers. He becomes aware tha Lisa is right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with humor) Are you following me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm taking these files to Mister Charles' office. They said it was this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek Charles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you probably know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, I know him. (lowers his voice) Kind of an asshole, takes himself waaaay too seriously. But don't tell him I said that.     L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could get you into trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching a desk where Derek's assistant, a mild-lookin man in his late 30's named PATRICK looks up and smiles. Across from Patrick is another desk and another assistant middle-aged woman named MARGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Derek. How's the new house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total chaos. Lucky for me, I sneaked out as soon as the movers showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth must have loved that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she calls mad -- and she will -- tell her I'm in a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember who used to sit at this desk? She'll know I am lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick CHUCKLES as Derek enters his office and vanishes inside. Patrick notices Lisa standing there with her arm load of files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lisa) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa stares at Derek's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Derek Charles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa breaks into a smile; obviously charmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick takes amused notice of Lisa's interest in Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATRICK (cont'd) (TEASING) Watch it, girl. He's married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good ones are always married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dramatic sigh) Or straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek sits at a long table with his silver-haired boss, J GAGE and his best friend and co-worker BEN KINGMAN. One w of the room is glass, giving a view of the outer office activity.            G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Derek) Did you talk to our German friend, Herr Ganz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matter of fact, I just got off the line to Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz doesn't like the way the Stock Market's been gyrating and he thinks the hedge fund wave is about to crest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no. I think he's a hundred percent wrong. We haven't even gotten close to that point yet. Hedge fund demand is coming from individual investors which is why it's gaining mainstream acceptance. You know Ganz. He gets paranoid when anything goes mainstream. He started making Auf Wiedersehen noises but I managed to talk him into a private equity portfolio instead... to the tune of 155 mil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PLEASED) I knew there was a reason I promoted you. No offense, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None taken, Joe. I'm just honored to be allowed to exist in Derek's world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek looks over at Ben who winks at him. They're friends and good-natured ribbing is part of their relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I want you to throw Derek all your support on this one.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: hat's when Lisa walks by on the other side of the glass. Gage perks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAGE (cont'd) Whose legs are those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never seen `em before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she's one of the temps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean temptress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me to call that agency and have them send over a couple more just like her. Doesn't hurt to have a little eye candy around the office, does it, boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben agrees. Derek merely nods.        He's not comfortabl this tone of sexism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End of the day. Workers are leaving. Derek passes an open office door. Ben sticks his head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I scored an extra Lakers ticket for tomorrow night. Think you can get free?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm moving into a new house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like a man who wants a divorce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could call and say it's a work emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I think I'll stay married instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben ducks back into his office.      Derek walks past a c on their way to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Mister Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek stops, turns and sees Lisa sitting at a computer station. She smiles. L ISA (cont'd) You punk'd me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry but you set me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with humor) Don't worry. I'll get my revenge.    And by the way, you might like to know everybody who works here strongly disagrees with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Derek Charles being an asshole. They all say he's the nicest guy in the firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that just proves he's got `em all fooled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's humble, too.   I'm Lisa, by the way. Lisa Sheridan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was nice to meet you, Lisa Sheridan. Good luck with your next job --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek continues on to the elevator.      Lisa calls after

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, they're keeping me on a few more days, so I'll probably see you on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't tell if he heard. Lisa watches him go out of sight, then, curious, she turns to her computer and pulls up Der bio and picture on the company web site:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Derek Charles graduated from UCLA with a major in financ Began his career with major Wall Street Brokerage firm be joining Gage/Bendix working with clients to help them accomplish their investment objectives. From asset allocation and investment planning, pension analysis, etc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is asleep in his crib. Derek and Beth look down on h smiling, then move quietly toward the door. Before they c sneak out, Kyle lets out A CRY. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.   Almost made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek returns to the crib and picks up Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, little man. What's wrong?    You should be... (feeling him) Uh oh. Poopy diaper. Beth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the doorway; with a laugh) I've been changing him all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth leaves. Derek carries Kyle over to the changing tabl opens Kyle's diaper and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whew.   What's that woman been feeding you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Beth sit at a table on the outside deck that overhangs a sheer drop to the canyon below. In the distan the LA basin sparkles like a diamond in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Beth are happy but exhausted. In front of them an empty pizza box. Derek picks up a bottle of champagne pours some for Beth and himself. They're both a little drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we toasted the house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toasted Kyle --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your promotion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've saved the most important toast for last... (raising his glass) To my beautiful wife who I love and adore more than anything in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to my handsome husband. I asked for the moon and he gave me the stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hey clink glasses and drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Derek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (YAWNS) Uh huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you feel about trying out that mirror again? This time in our own bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perks up) Yeah? Give the magic mirror another test drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how I like looking at your sexy butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, you are so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that WHY you married ME?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek arrives to find Lisa sitting at his outer desk in Patrick's place. She looks up and smiles. She's not weari her glasses and her hair is down giving her a softer, les severe look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.   Remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa Sheridan, Girl Temp.     Where's Patrick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out with the flu. I did some trading with the other temps and wrangled your desk. I hope that's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking over at the assistant outside the other corner office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) Hey Marge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the temp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab your pad and follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek goes into his office.       Lisa collects her thing does as told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek goes behind the desk as Lisa enters and sits down o the couch. She crosses her legs. Those great legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put a memo on your desk about the Christmas party this Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it that time already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek picks up the memo and scans it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't they invite spouses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the Christmas party.    It says "for employees only."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like that in most companies. They think people are more inhibited in front of their spouses, less likely to kick back and enjoy themselves and mingle with co-workers, which is what the party is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, does this party get pretty wild?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's no fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek notices a container of Starbucks coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) I called Patrick. He said you like it black with two sugars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is impressed.    He opens the container.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) If it's cold, I can run down and nuke it in the Break Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes a sip) No, it's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is pleased.    She raises her pad and pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's Monday and first thing on Monday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took care of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took care of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Mondays you always send your wife a dozen long-stemmed red roses. (off Derek's look of surprise) I called to confirm they've been delivered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's incredibly sweet.   How long have you two been married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years in March.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you still send her flowers every Monday morning? Lucky girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of a tradition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick said you started sending them back when Beth worked here as your assistant. Is that how you won her heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it took a little more than roses. (getting down to business) We need to run some calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (POISED) Ready when you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMUSED) Are you always this efficient?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that surprise you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's just that most of the temps we get here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'll find I'm not your typical temp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Definitely not. (THEN) Okay not your typical temp... start with Phil Trendle at Emerson... set up a lunch for end of the week. Wherever he wants but push the Water Grill. Then Terry Mills at Imagio. Am I going too fast for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Go faster.   I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is feeding Kyle while talking on the phone to Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful little park with a duck pond and close enough to push Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUTTING DEREK IN HIS OFFICE, while he listens and go over reports.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) I've already met a dozen other women with kids the same age. One of them, Lauren something asked if we'd like to come over for a barbecue on Saturday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's shaping up to be a work weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, at her desk, Lisa eavesdrops on her headset, listening with interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can work at home and then we'll go to the barbecue.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: s Beth chats on, Derek gets a weird feeling. Still on the phone, he slowly gets up from his desk and moves quietly the door. He looks out, expecting to catch Lisa listening in. Instead, she's not at her desk. She's standing severa feet away at a file cabinet. She turns and smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek shakes his head no and steps back into his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek finishes some work on his home computer.       In t background, Beth sits in bed reading a book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work at the office.     This is home.   Come to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek finishes. He rises, walks over to the bed and climb in beside Beth. She puts her book on the night table and switches off the light. They cuddle together. Beth CHUCKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The card that came today with the roses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... was addressed "To Betty."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with humor) Yeah. Who's Betty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blame it on the new girl. Patrick called in sick and I had a temp on my desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had a deal. No female assistants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I don't control the temp pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pretty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek gives Beth a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ETH (cont'd) Just asking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's pretty... plain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. I want her fired immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, she did a great job... aside from the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get comfortable.      Beth puts her head on Derek's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night, Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night... Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth LAUGHS, gives him a playful punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO DELIVERY GUYS come out of the stairwell, struggling w an undecorated Christmas tree. Marge directs them to a sp to put it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Kyle are visiting. Derek has Kyle on his desk, letting him play with his keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you don't mind us dropping in unannounced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding? This is a treat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheila's meeting us for lunch at Central Market. Then I'm taking Kyle to the Grove. (to Kyle) And who are we going to see at the Grove?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Derek) You want to come?   Get your picture taken on Santa's lap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to but I'm all jammed up.     But say hi to your sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy she was seeing, the one we met at Thanksgiving... Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one she said was perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently he's not so perfect.   He told her he just wants to be FWB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FWB?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends With Benefits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know.    Sex but no commitments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Sheila's got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth laughs.       Lisa appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn.    Lisa smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa, this is my wife Beth.       Beth, Lisa. She's temping for Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly but checking her out) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's great to meet you, Mrs. Charles. eyes lighting up) And this must be Kyle. I can already tell he's going to grow up to be a heartbreaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa comes over.       Kyle presses shyly against Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) Hi, Kyle.     I'm Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Kyle doesn't respond...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle, say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can say hello. He's usually not this shy around strangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a handsome boy. (to Derek) He looks just like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, most people think he takes after Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk about the perfect family. The three of you should be on a magazine cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope my husband's not working you too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheery tone) He is. But I like it. I'm learning a lot. (to Derek) Joe Gage needs to see you when you get a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's our cue to leave.    We just dropped in to say hi. (taking Kyle from Derek) Come on, big boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa steps back, moves off to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was great to meet you... Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too... Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did it on purpose, winking at Derek.    He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Lisa.      You said Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Lisa knows she's being fucked with, she doesn't show i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Sorry.   Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WAVING) Bye, Kyle. Say hi to Santa for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa exits.   A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beth) That was intentional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't me. Blame "Betty."    So what's the deal with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew I was taking Kyle to Santa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she was obviously listening at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she probably didn't know when to come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said she was plain. Derek, that girl may be a lot of things but one of them is not plain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would I know?    I only have eyes for you.      B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS) Oh, you are so slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put Kyle in his stroller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. I'll walk you to the elevator. You can say hi to the old gang. (BEAT) Ever miss it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to think I traded up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek beams.    They share a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, Beth and Kyle are surrounded by office workers mak a fuss over Beth and Kyle. Even Joe Gage comes out of his office to embrace Beth and chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa watches from a distance. Her face betrays no emotion After a moment, she turns and enters Derek's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: isa sits behind the desk in Derek's chair and look at a framed picture on Derek's desk -- Derek, Beth and Kyle, t perfect happy family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, Lisa sees a pile of CD's.    She looks through th smiles with an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warm LA morning with a hot sun coming up.    Derek driv work, listening to Gnarls' "Crazy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers hang bulbs and decorations on the Christmas tree. festive holiday spirit is in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek exits the elevator, heads to his office.      Patri back at his desk.    D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Patrick. Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it's going to take more than the flu to keep me away from that Christmas party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure we can say the same for Marge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek turns to see Lisa, now sitting at Marge's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get around don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor thing called in with a fever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... She's not speaking to me at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he three share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.   You two behave yourselves out here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek goes into his office.       We stay with Patrick and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Lisa) So, how many times did you get busted listening in on Derek's calls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (light laugh) I'm way too devious to ever get caught. Besides, I thought all you assistants listened in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) We do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   Lisa wonders if she might make a friend here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you worked here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten years this Spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet you know more about what goes on behind these closed doors than anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you got that right girl.    I know all the dirty little secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe we should grab a drink some night after work for a little girl talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lonely guy; flattered by her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, honey, if you think you can buy my silence with a couple of Cosmo's... you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a laugh, bonding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted at lunch hour. Derek, in shirtsleeves, emerges f his office and approaches the Break Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek enters, opens the refrigerator and takes out a lunc bag. He hears a slight SNIFFLING NOISE, turns and is surprised to find Lisa seated a corner table, a little tearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks up, quickly wipes her eyes with her hand and p on a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.     I thought everybody was at lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward moment.    Lisa starts to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) I should go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stay. I was just gonna take this back to my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa sits back down.    Derek starts to leave; hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) Anything I can do to help?     I mean... if you want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most people I know don't cry over nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ( with humor) You think I was crying?     This is just my allergies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.     What are you allergic to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men, apparently. Actually it's more like they're allergic to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boyfriend trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa hesitates, wondering if she can confide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stupid really. (a beat) This guy I've been seeing just calls and dumps me. Middle of the day. No warning. No explanation. Just "I don't think we should see each other anymore."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUCH!!! That's pretty cold.    How long were you together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two months. small laugh) Actually, it was one of my longer lasting relationships. I don't know what it is but sooner or later I just seem to scare men off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm starting to think there's something wrong with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek sits down beside her.       He puts a comforting ha shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like a big brother) Nothing wrong with you. Your boyfriend's a fool, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you just haven't met the right guy yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to think all the good ones are taken. D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm no expert but if it didn't work out, maybe it wasn't meant to be. When the right guy comes along... you'll know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at him; smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how it was with you and Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, yeah.      We both knew pretty quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love at first sight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.     Now I'm jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got it all.   Perfect husband, perfect child, perfect marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's perfect. There are problems in every relationship. The important thing is to keep moving forward. trying to buck her up) Don't get down on yourself. You're a bright, attractive girl. Any man would be lucky to have you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.     Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. If I was single...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just meant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. You're just trying to make me feel better. (touches his hand) And you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) Thanks, Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang in there. It'll happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa nods.    She smiles and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ncident forgotten, Derek opens his lunch bag and takes ou sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: en appears in the doorway, grins at Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor kid got dumped by her boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I wouldn't mind taking up the slack. That is one hot piece of ass there. (off Derek's look) Like you haven't noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm a happily married man.   And so are you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't mean we can't look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben goes to the refrigerator, opens it and starts rooting around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEN (cont'd) Not like the old days, back when you could get away with a little office nookie on the side and not get nailed for it. (turns and gives him a grin) Don't give me that "I'm appalled" look. That's how you got together with Beth, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, if you're looking to start something with that girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw her first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I don't think I'm her type.     Now you on the other hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben, do me a favor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm just sayin' is a lot of these single gals see the work place as a hunting ground. cocking his finger like a gun) And this one's got you in the cross hairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a grin, Ben "pulls the trigger -- bang!" and exits. Derek looks a little annoyed.                          C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek at his desk. He notices an envelope with his name o it. He opens the envelope. A note and a home-made CD slid out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Thanks for the shoulder, Lisa.   (Thought you might like these.)"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, Derek feeds the CD into his computer, lowers the volume and is hit with Gnarls Barkley in concert. He turn down the volume and smiles, continues to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hear the ding of an IM on his computer.     It's from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek considers, types back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reply: CONCERT BOOTLEG.   TOTALLY ILLEGAL.   WE COULD BE ARRESTED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He responds: WORTH THE RISK.   I LUV GNARLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reply: ME 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He responds:   THANX.    GET BACK 2 WORK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She replies: GONE DADDY GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek smiles, then goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast. Beth and Derek at the table. Derek is feeding Kyle. We can see a naked, undecorated Christmas tree in t next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On your way home, can you pick up those Baby Einstein DVD's for you know who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to do it tomorrow.      Office party's tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot. Well, if you drink too much, take a cab, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's anything like last year, I'll be home early. (THEN) Kyle, I want you to eat this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle shakes his head "no" and points at the Christmas tre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Santa. And he's coming soon. So eat. Don't you know Santa only brings presents to boys who eat all their food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle considers; then furiously eats.    Derek and Beth LA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek sits at the bar by himself, reading the paper. He looks up and sees Lisa come in. Lisa catches Derek's eye, surprised. Then she smiles, starts to make her way over..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing to the empty stool next to him) This seat taken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (always a good guy) No. Be my guest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is sitting next to Derek at the bar. The food has co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still the best burger in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa chews and nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EREK (CONT'D) (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And the best Margarita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises her eyebrows) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to cut loose here after a long day at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work hard, play hard.   Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that boyfriend trouble coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep moving forward, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you, Derek?   What's the grand plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, run the company by 35. Jet by 40. Retire to my private island and own the Lakers by 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: isa laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lakers suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not with me in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touche.   They both smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A margarita?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon big talker... it's Christmas time. Works dead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek's not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) I won't tell if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. One.     What do you like? Strawberry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocks. Salt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Christmas party is in full swing with MUSIC, TWO BARTENDERS and lowered lights.   The tree is all lit up. mood is happy and playful and people are getting a little tipsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MALE WORKER gives A FEMALE WORKER a back massage with a computer mouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Gage, in a Santa suit, is passing out gag presents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is in a group with Patrick and some other women, chatting. She glances over and sees Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's off to the side with Ben, sipping drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: esks and furniture are shoved back and workers are free- style dancing, crowding into the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: arge grabs Derek by the arm and pulls him out. Derek make some half-hearted dance moves, then gets into the spirit. It's crowded, people are close together and a moment late Derek finds himself dancing face to face with Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with humor) Well, if it isn't the Office Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mister Office Asshole to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed.      You can dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those years watching Soul Train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't sure I was going to come tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not like I've been here that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure everybody's glad you decided to show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "even me?" I'm your number one supporter around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes her smile happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek looks up, too.       They're under the mistletoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did that get there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, smile.       An awkward moment. laughs it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PLAYFUL) Maybe a quick one on the cheek? If we don't, people will really suspect there's something going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Derek steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we'll just have to take that chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (good natured laugh) Coward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music changes, breaking the mood.       Derek smiles and slips away, rejoining Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not thinking about bailing, are you? Fun's just getting started. Remember last year? Sally Sloane did a table dance.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: e indicates a pretty secretary LAUGHING and accepting another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEN (cont'd) I give her one more drink, then stand back.   How about you, buddy? Need a re- fill? Come on, where's your holiday spirit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Beth and Kyle.       I'm gonna take a piss and sneak out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're no fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek heads down the hall, a little unsteady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek enters. No one else around. He goes to the urinal a begins to unzip. About 30 seconds later he hears the door open and close but thinks nothing of it because it is a l public Men's restroom in the workplace with 4 urinals and stalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But suddenly, a hand snakes around his waist and grabs hi crotch. Derek whirls around, face to face with a brazen, smiling Lisa who dangles a sprig of Mistletoe in her free hand. Her eyes flash with desire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ALARMED) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa tries to kiss him. Derek resists. He staggers away from the urinal with Lisa still holding him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) Lisa --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They knock open a stall door and fall in. Derek goes back against the toilet and Lisa is now practically straddling him.                 D EREK (cont'd) Lisa, stop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you out of your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when someone comes in. Derek kicks the stall door shut with his foot just in time. He and Lisa freeze, pres close together as A DRUNK MALE WORKER staggers to the uri and unzips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa hides a GIGGLE.    Derek is horrified they'll be discovered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Drunk begins to piss. Loudly. And then begins to sing Santa Claus is coming to town... even more loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the stall, Lisa and Derek are face to face. His hand grabs her wrist as she squeezes his crotch. He tries to remove it but her grip is like a vice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) For god's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing something, the Drunk hesitates in mid-piss, looks back over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is trapped. Lisa gives him a naughty smile. She's i control and enjoying this, turned on by the thrill of get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRUNK (cont'd) Somebody in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is about to answer.      Derek hushes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When there's no reply, the Drunk resumes pissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa smears the Mistletoe sprig against Derek's face, the starts to go down on him. He clutches her head with both hands forcing her to stop. She looks up at him, eyes gleaming with passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Drunk continues his piss. Endless. Finally.. finished He clumsily zips back up, lurches over to the sink. He lo at himself in the mirror, runs his fingers through his ha smiles at himself and then stumbles out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stall door bangs open as Derek pushes Lisa aside and staggers out, trying to zip up his fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the wrong idea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa doesn't seem to understand but she's amused.    Dere already out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a wilder scene now. Sally Sloane is doing an uninhibited table dance to the delight of everyone gather

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: atrick, standing off, sees Derek hurry down the hall and head for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moment later, he sees Lisa come down the hall and rejoin the party. A little tipsy, he walks over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living dangerously, aren't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Patrick, you're such an old queen. (THEN) Come on. Dance with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa pulls Patrick out with the other dancers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) (as they dance; teasing) I 'll bet you've never been this close to an actual woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I've never been this close to an actual man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek drives home. He's agitated, trying to calm down, trying to make sense of what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when he hears a SIREN. Derek's eyes go up to the r view mirror in panic as a police car with flashing lights gains on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek pulls over, heart pounding.   This is all he needs now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car flies by on its way to some emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek closes his eyes; lets out a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swept by headlights as Derek pulls into the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.   Derek looks in on his sleeping son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Derek approaches the bed where Beth sleeps.     He in beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SLEEPY) How was the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only stayed for two drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That dull, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.   Derek considers telling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight, honey, okay?   I'm really tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Beth is already back asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek lies there, in Hell. He looks up and sees his own d reflection in the ceiling mirror.                     C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek gets off the elevator and walks to his office, turn corner and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa coming the other way, carrying files. Derek tenses a stops, expecting the worst. Lisa merely gives him a pleas smile and walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the other night never happened. Lisa continues on he way, delivering the files to a co-worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek stands there, observing Lisa, wondering.        Ben beside Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, bro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek turns, a little startled.        He registers Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have stuck around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Christmas party. Hank in Human Services tossed his cookies on the Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely registering) Really? Sorry I missed that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek goes to his office.        Ben goes to his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek is at his desk, working.       Lisa appears in the d Derek looks up; tensing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (WARY) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe wants to know if you're done with the Ganz portfolio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him he'll have it end of the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts to go) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're working Joe's desk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for today. light laugh) He's a real screamer, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him fool you.   His bark really is as bad as his bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa smiles and exits.    Derek is thinking Great, maybe doesn't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is at his desk working. It's the end of the day and workers are leaving. Patrick appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay if I take off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick leaves. Through the open door, Derek can see othe workers leaving, getting on the elevator. Lisa is one of them. She doesn't even look his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek relaxes, goes back to his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek walks to his Yukon SUV, the only car remaining. BEEPS it and the doors unlock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Derek opens the driver's door and slides inside, the passenger door opens and Lisa slips in, wearing her overc and an intimate smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you an apology for the Christmas party. I think I sort of took you by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both had a few drinks.   Just forget it.       L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa... nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, have it your way.   Nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa lets the front of her overcoat fall open.        She underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jolt of panic) You really need to get out of my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. Nobody's around to see us now. God, I almost went insane today, didn't you? Having to go pretend like I was concentrating on work when all I could think about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa, get out of my car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled; confused) Derek, what's wrong? What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek suddenly reaches across her and throws open the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you're just dense or what's wrong with you but I want you to understand something. There's nothing going on between us. I would never -- never -- jeopardize my job with a co- worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you are an asshole. Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek physically forces her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek quickly turns the key in the ignition, REVS the eng and peels out in reverse. The passenger door bangs shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa stands there in her overcoat staring in mute disappointment as Derek speeds out of the parking garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek lets himself in, determined to tell Beth everything

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CALLING) Beth? Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek heads for the dining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I need to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, seeing Beth at the table, looking upset with a bottle of wine and a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been on the phone for the last hour with Rachel MORE) ( Hendricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She found out Tim's been having an affair with a neighbor and it's been going on for the last year and a half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops dead) Tim? Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek sits down at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I couldn't even conceive of it. They've always seemed to be so much in love, totally devoted to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim... told her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just blurted it out last night when he came home from work. Then he said he was moving out. You know they've got three kids. Poor Rachel's a wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    That's tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough?    It's a disaster.   If it was me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, you know I'd never cheat on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek reaches across the table and takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e moves closer and puts an arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tim's an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a son of a bitch. (beat; then) What did you want to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way he can tell her now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. Just a little problem at work.     (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (BEAT) Nothing I can't take care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, agitated, has confided in Ben who's both concerned a little turned on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was nothing to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to tell? She grabbed your cock? Flashed her tits in your car? Come on, man. I thought I was your best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... jeez. I mean, I kinda got she was interested but I never figured she'd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell did I do?    I was nice to her, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you didn't lead her on? Just a little? I mean, a pretty girl... it would be normal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do a damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she thinks she can make the jump from assistant to wife, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.   You're a big help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report it to Human Resources...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her fired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be very careful if I were you. What if she makes trouble and says you came on to her?

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: erek gives Ben a look.       C'mon man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEN (CONT'D) (cont'd) Look... it's not like you don't have a history of behavior here. When's the last time you had a female assistant on your desk? People are going to wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I need to get my side on the record first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; making a joke) Wouldn't it be cheaper to just have her killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek frowns at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A determined Derek arrives and enters the offices of HENR TRUMAN, IN CHARGE OF HUMAN RESOURCES. A SECRETARY looks u from her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Mister Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Connie. Is Hank in?     I need to talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the inner office) Derek? That you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek enters Hank's office and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Hank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's sort of a personal matter.   I need to talk to you about one of the temps, Lisa Sheridan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   She worked your desk for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about to confess) Listen, Hank, this going to be a little awkward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're here to file a complaint about her performance, save your breath. Her agency called this morning and said she wouldn't be coming in any more. They already sent over a replacement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hiding is surprise) She quit? They give a reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Did you have some kind of a problem with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I just thought she was unqualified, sort of in over her head. But if she already quit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like she beat you to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absorbing this) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the new house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New house is great. a smile) Couldn't be better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Beth I said hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will. Listen. We'll have you and Kathy over some night when we're more settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek opens the door and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, down the hall, Ben is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben grins.    He raises his hand for a high five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, bro.     That's good news.   Problem solved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as his good luck sinks     in) Looks that way, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad little Christmas present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, happier now, returns the high five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christmas morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hrough the window we see Derek, Beth and Kyle under the t unwrapping presents, having a great time. For Derek, all troubles are forgotten.                                C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, at his desk, in a good mood, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hans? Derek. How was your Christmas? Well, you people invented it. You got the prospectus? Great. Look it over. I think it's gonna be a happy new year for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek looks at the doorway where Ben is standing. Derek gives Ben the thumbs up. Ben beams and does a little vict dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Beth come in, dressed in tux and gown, exhauste from a New Years party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God,   it's after three. That's the last time   I'm going out on New Years Eve. Next   year we'll celebrate here at home. Just   you, me and Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "You Have Mail" DING comes from Derek's home computer o the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just gonna check my e-mail and come to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't it wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already tomorrow in Berlin. Ganz was supposed to send me his approval. That's probably him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes into the adjoining bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a YAWN, Derek sits down at his computer and goes to mail. He scans it and is instantly confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of e-mails, all from the same sender: TEMPGIRL.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: little fearful, Derek pulls up the first e-mail. It opens up to reveal a self-taken photo of Lisa looking sexy and inviting on a bed, smiling seductively and wearing skimpy lingerie that shows off her sexy body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nder her photo: SEE YOU IN THE NEW YEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek feels a jolt of panic.    He deletes it, brings up others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: t's the same photo, Lisa on the bed, over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek stares at Lisa on screen, feeling sick and invaded. isn't aware of Beth coming out of the bathroom behind him She approaches as he continues to delete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ganz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's about to peer over his shoulder. Derek hits the del key and the last photo of Lisa disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acting perturbed) Nothing. I gotta get a new spam blocker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth gives him a kiss on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. He'll call you in the morning. Come to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek stares at the computer screen saver: A picture of Be with Kyle sitting on Santa's knee at the Grove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is at his desk, tensely typing on the computer, sen an e-mail to TEMPGIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek types: LEAVE ME ALONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sends it and sits back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost instantly there's a reply.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: erek stiffens.   Then, tentatively, he opens the new e-ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEMPGIRL has replied with one of those annoying YELLOW SM FACES. It winks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is chilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mid-January.   The withered Christmas tree waits at the c for pick-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth helps Derek pack a bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the last time Joe had one of his weekend work retreats?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I forget?   I had a hangover for a week after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any women coming this year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just the usual suspects. Joe says it's going to be a male bonding experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can just picture you guys in the hotel jacuzzi, getting in touch with your innermost feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (zips up his bag) Hopefully, they'll all get drunk and crash early. Or if I'm really lucky... drown in the jacuzzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek gives her a kiss.     Their image is reflected in th overhead mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COCKTAIL WAITRESS delivers drinks to Derek, Joe Gage, B Talbot and THREE OTHER MEN smoking cigars and relaxing af dinner. The mood is rowdy. They're all a little toasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drink is put in front of Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't order this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cocktail Waitress leans down and WHISPERS in his ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from the lady at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: erek turns and peers at the crowded bar area. He catches flash of a young woman in a tight dress seated on a stool But a crowd of people move into his line of vision and wh they clear, the woman is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek tenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.      Just thought I saw somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody you know?     Or somebody you'd like to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other guys chortle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.   You can't tempt this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who could blame him with a wife like Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of Beth, I said I'd give her a call before she puts Kyle to bed. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek picks up his drink and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry back. This party's just getting started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low-lit. Empty. Derek comes out, flips open his cell to call home. He puts his drink down on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, honey. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUTTING WITH BETH in Kyle's bedroom, putting him to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the male bonding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all getting wasted. Any minute now, Joe's going to suggest the Jacuzzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if your future depends on putting on a bathing suit and hot tubbing it with a bunch of drunks... Derek? You there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek freezes. Across the patio, he sees A FIGURE slowly approaching. It's a woman back-lit, a silhouette. But as she passes into the light from the bar, she's revealed as Lisa, transformed into an alluring femme fatale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.   Kyle wants to say good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're yelling for me to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just take a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth picks up Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Say good night to Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lisa comes closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in bed -- Derek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek clicks off and pockets his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other end, Beth looks perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Lisa comes face to face with Derek, smiling.     She picks up his drink and takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can always tell from the pained look on your face when you're talking to Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know I'd be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got my sources. slight frown) What's wrong? You don't look happy to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you come here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you could never be with someone you work with. (when he doesn't seem to "get

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I quit. So we could be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek looks at her, astounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding down panic) Lisa, you need to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing smile) Or what? You'll make a scene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Call security? What would Joe and Ben and the others think? I'll tell you what they'd think. They'd think we arranged it. And in a way, we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa turns aside. Out of Derek's sight, she slips a capsu into his drink, then puts it back on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) This hook-up was on the books from the day we met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us   has to take control and I guess it's me.    So you go back, say your good nights to   the boys and I'll be waiting in my room.    610.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming to your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you rather I came to yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy... sick.      You need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I need help. (moves closer; seductive) Help me, Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She presses against him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa emits a musical little laugh and smooths her dress. registers Derek's angry face and clenched fists. She smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Derek. You play your games... (turning away) ... and I'll play mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa disappears into the darkness, high heels echoing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek feel his cell phone vibrate.     He pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?   It's Ben. Where the hell are you, bro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here.     Coming back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agitated, Derek picks up his drink, downs it and re-enter the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
