dialogues.text: After midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek and Ben get off the elevator. Ben is slightly drunk but Derek is farther gone -- wobbly on his feet, bleary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, it's early. We'll go to my room and plunder the mini-bar, charge it all to Joe.   D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't, man. That last drink totally kicked my ass. I need to lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, be that way. But don't forget. Nine o'clock in the California Room. Joe's big rah-rah to the troops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben goes one way, Derek the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, feeling more and more disoriented, makes his way t his room. He fishes around in his pockets and finds his k card. He slides it and pushes open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek lets himself in, doesn't even click on the lights. There's enough moonlight coming through the window to lea him to the bed where he flops down on his back. He doesn' even bother to undress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek closes his eyes, then opens them. He feels sick. Sound and perception are playing games with his head. The room begins to spin and he can hear a sound, a rushing no Is it the shower in the bathroom? The bathroom door is sh but there's a crack of light around the edges. Is someone there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is too out of it to care. He just wants to sleep, m it go away. He closes his eyes, begins to drift off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom door opens, letting in a cloud of steam and shaft of light. A woman's silhouette appears, naked. She moves to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: erek feels the bed move... feels a tug on his trousers... then, an amplified ZZZZIIIPPP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek's eyes open in shock. He can't believe what he sees Lisa, naked, straddling him. Her hand caressing his face. It's like a dream. A nightmare. Lisa smiles seductively a puts a finger to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy; can barely get the word out) No..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice seems distorted like it's coming from another world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) I'm going to take real good care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek tries to resist but finds he has no control over hi body or mind. All he can see is a shifting, distorted ima of Lisa's face... her smile... her teeth.. her lips... th blazing look of sexual desire in her eyes. And somewhere those eyes he can see HIMSELF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the last thing Derek sees before he passes out the entire world goes black and silent.                C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazzling sunlight.       Derek wakes up, startled by a po the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Housekeeping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek blinks, blinded by the sun. His brain is fogged and he's disoriented. It takes him a moment to realize where is. A hotel room. Naked under the covers. How did he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WOMAN'S VOICE (cont'd) Housekeeping!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door begins to open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later! Come back later!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    I come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek glances over at the clock. 10:15. Shit.    He's overslept and now he's late for the seminar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek starts to get up, looks over and -- his heart stops

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Lisa sprawled beside him on her stomach, naked un the covers. She opens her eyes and gives him a sexy, slee smile, stretching her body like a cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek goes into panic mode, jumping out of the bed like i on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave!   You've got to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek grabs Lisa by the arm, drags her out of the bed at same time gathering her clothes from the floor and thrust them into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?   You worried somebody's gonna catch us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get the hell out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (HALF-AMUSED) We woke up a little grumpy this morning, didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa barely manages to slip into her dress before Derek o the door and pushes her out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISA (cont'd) Derek, what is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek slams the door.       On the other side, we hear Li musical laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) All right.     Have it your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek locks the door. Shaking, he goes to the bed, sits o the edge and buries his throbbing head in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in hell) Fuck... fuck... fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek slips in and takes a seat next to Ben at the end of big table. The other guys are there, also a little under weather. They take notice of his late arrival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting his talk) Thank god. We were about to send out a search party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.   Overslept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek glances over at Ben who frowns at him. Derek looks over at the wall clock as Joe resumes talking. 10:35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now 12:50. While Joe continues his talk, A HOTEL CLE quietly slips into the room, goes over to Derek and whisp to him. Derek perks up with concern. He leans over to Ben

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) It's Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek follows the Clerk.          As they turn a corner..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's your wife, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek stops dead. It's not Beth waiting for him. It's Lis dressed sexy/casual, bright smile. The Clerk goes away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might need an excuse to get out of there. How about some lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gorgeous outside and I made a reservation at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek grabs her by the elbow and hustles her out of sight trying to keep his voice down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't do anything last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa gives him a sly smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't remember, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, not so loud.   You'll cause a scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   A scene. need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek hauls her roughly back down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I   should have done last night. Taking   you inside to tell Joe and the others   whatever you want. They'll know you're   out of your mind.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: e yanks her toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to pull away) Why are you trying to ruin this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERE IS NO THIS!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Godammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek throws her roughly against the wall.      She hits head, a little stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek steps back, surprised by his own violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?   You're acting like a stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! That's exactly what I am. A stranger, a person you don't know. Now either go inside and tell them your bullshit lies or get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flaring; ugly tone) You think you can use me, then throw me away? I'm not some piece of garbage, Derek. I'm a human being...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa reaches out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, in frustration, raises his hand as if to strike he Her eyes flash with excitement. Derek stops himself, revolted by his own behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) Do it. Hit me. You can do anything you want to me. Don't you know that? Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek stares at her like she's a thing, an object.    He his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ISA (cont'd) Don't look at me that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How else do you look at somebody who sickens and repulses you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what you do or what you say. What goes on in that twisted mind of yours. It doesn't matter because the truth is, there's never going to be anything between us. So go ahead, Lisa... do your worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, Derek turns and goes into the seminar room, closing door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a heartbreaking expression of hurt, Lisa stares at t door for a long moment, wipes a tear from her face and wa away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, Ben, Joe and the others eat dinner. A lively atmosphere. Derek seems apart from the others, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, you drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight, man.   I'm sticking to ice tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek gets off on his floor and heads to his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek steps inside and freezes, confronted with his worst nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High heels and a path of discarded clothing leads to the where Lisa lies in bed, naked under the covers, her eyes shut, seemingly asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anger rising) No. No fucking way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek moves toward the bed and the sleeping girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EREK (cont'd) Goddamn it, Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Her head is cocked to one side and her skin ghostly pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek leans over and shakes Lisa's naked shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) Lisa, get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like shaking a doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) Get up or I'll drag you out and throw you in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when Derek sees it. On the night stand: an empty bottle of prescription pills. Derek picks up the bottle a looks at the label: Ambien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek grabs the bedside phone and punches Desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) (fighting panic) This is 622. There's a woman in my room, she's taken an overdose of prescription pills -- Ambien. You need to get the paramedics and security up here right away. Please hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek hangs up. Now he puts one knee on the bed and takes Lisa's face in his hands, turning her head. He might as w be handling a marionette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. He puts his ear to her naked chest, trying t detect a heartbeat. If there is one, he can't hear it. Derek gently slaps her cheeks. Rolls back her eye lids. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) Oh god...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Derek begins to perform CPR. He tilts Lisa's jaw back clears her mouth and begins to breathe into her, alternat chest compressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EREK (cont'd) Lisa!   Wake up, goddamn it...              C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a corner, Derek looks haggard, being interviewed by a veteran police detective, MONICA REYES. Reyes looks more like a middle-aged suburban mom than a cop but she's very good at her job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Mister Charles, let me get this straight. E)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYES(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This girl you barely know, works in your office, fantasizes you're having an affair and when you reject her, she tries to commit suicide in your bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how it sounds but, yeah, that's pretty much it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This affair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There WAS NO affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So she just... made it up in her head? With no help from you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I was too nice to her, said something she took the wrong way, I don't know. All I know is I did not lead her on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you had no idea she'd be at the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None. I don't even know how she got in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently she told one of the housekeepers she was your wife and lost her key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that prove she did this on her own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All it proves is she lost her key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never had a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mister Charles, I don't care if you were or weren't banging this girl. I just need to get your version for my report.   (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYES(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Besides, if it's a question of innocence, I'm not the one you have to convince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I wouldn't like to explain a situation like this to my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Derek can respond, Reyes sees AN ER DOCTOR signall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYES (cont'd) I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reyes goes to talk to the Doctor. Derek watches them talk The Doctor hands Reyes a piece of paper. Derek can't stan the suspense. He walks over and interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reyes nods to the Doctor and takes Derek aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pumped her out in time. Doctor says she's groggy and disoriented. Probably tomorrow they'll move her out of ICU and up to the fifth floor for a psychiatric evaluation. All suicides are put on 72 hour hold, it's standard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, she was lucid long enough to give the doctor a name to call in case of emergency. He wrote it down. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reyes hands Derek a piece of paper.   Written on it is DE CHARLES and his phone number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYES (cont'd) Still want to stick to your story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn is breaking as Derek guides the Yukon into the drive He steps out, hesitates. The front door of the house open to reveal a very tense looking Beth in a robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other across the distance.     Derek wa her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little cold) Tell me everything.   From the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek nods.    This is not going to be easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek has told it all. Beth, looking stunned, stares at hi uncomprehending. A long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you let this happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I encouraged it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you liked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What man wouldn't? The attentions of a pretty young girl? I can just see those adoring blue eyes batting at you every time you told her how pretty she looked or what a nice dress --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Beth. You know I never said those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have said something. Done something to give her the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I did, it wasn't intentional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was in your bed, Derek! You spent the night together and you want me to believe nothing happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was passed out... drunk.     Nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, Derek.   Damn you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth turns away, her face burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Beth. I love Kyle and the life we have together. I would never do anything to screw that up. This girl is disturbed. She's seriously disturbed and for some reason, she fixated on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have told me. From the very beginning, you should have told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I thought it was no big deal. And then... I was just embarrassed. I didn't know how to explain it to you without looking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she know about us, Derek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this, Beth.    You'll make yourself sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I know I screwed up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek reaches out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) But I've told you the truth.    I have to know you believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weary sigh) I don't know what to believe. All I know is, I need to be alone for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to be alone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth moves quickly upstairs. Leaving Derek there. He sits back on the couch, head in his hands. At a loss. After a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek makes a determined rush up after her. Only to find bedroom door locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek's upset. Resigned, he makes his way over to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs a pillow. Punches it twice. Knows he's in the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is propped up in a hospital bed, a dark brooding expression on her face, tangled hair hanging down. Just staring, eyes wide, a little dopey looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica Reyes appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Reynolds? I'm Monica Reyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: isa looks up.      Her face transforms into a bright smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. I'm sorry I'm such a mess but they won't let me take a shower or wash my hair. (dismissive laugh) Apparently I'm still on suicide watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a police officer assigned to your case. How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, still a bit groggy from the medication. But it isn't stopping me from feeling ashamed for all the trouble I've caused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you feel like talking about the other night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you spoken to Derek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relatively speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can I see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Sheridan, I don't think Mister Charles wants to speak to you or continue any kind of contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks at her oddly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did he send these? Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa indicates a bouquet of flowers in a vase nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keeping the surprise out of her voice) He sent you flowers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peonies.   My favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reyes inspects the attached card. "Lisa Darling, the othe night was just a misunderstanding. Don't ever leave me. Love always, Derek."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did these show up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few hours ago.    They're lovely, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eyes decides not to push it, goes into her Q & A:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell me what happened at the hotel, why you were there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Derek tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to hear your version.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not a lot to tell. We got together at the hotel and you can guess what we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slept together.    Had sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek denies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just being a gentleman, trying to protect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.     Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next day when Derek told me his wife wouldn't give him a divorce and that we could never see each other again, I guess I over reacted. BEAT) I didn't realize he was just being noble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was thinking about his little boy, Kyle... what the breakup might do to him. He's not even two, you know. My parents broke up when I was pretty young. It leaves a scar that never really heals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you believe Mister Charles is in love with you? L

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read the card. Derek and I belong together and nothing can change that. But I do feel bad about his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a home-wrecker. I'm not stealing him away. Their marriage is dead and Beth is in denial. It can't be easy to find out that the man she loves is in love with another woman. I just hope she doesn't do something foolish. strange smile) You know the old saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa could almost be talking about herself.   Reyes nods she's chilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take it easy now.   We'll talk again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She excuses herself.   Lisa goes back to happily smiling her flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Joe Gage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to tell you how an incident like this could impact the company. Even the slightest whiff of impropriety...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no impropriety, Joe. This is just the sick fantasy of a very disturbed girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who might retaliate by hitting us with a sexual harassment lawsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no sexual harassment. If anything, I'm the one who was sexually harassed. (SIGHS) I can't believe this is happening to me. It's like a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, you're probably wishing you had fucked her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek gives him a shocked look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OE (cont'd) For all the trouble it's costing you. (THEN) Sorry. Bad joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamit, Joe, if there's an injured party here, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, calm down. I believe you and you know I'll back you up all the way. But if I find out there was something going on, I won't have a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to happen because there's nothing to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Then you have nothing to worry about. Meantime I'm going to put Ben on the Ganz account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Ganz is my client --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, maybe you should take some time off. Just til this blows over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marge sticks her head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt. Derek, there's a Detective Reyes here to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Derek exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Monica Reyes face each other across Derek's des

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She obviously ordered the flowers for herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With your credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My secretary keeps all my personal information on her computer. Lisa must have accessed it when she was working my desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reyes gives him a blank look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) You think I sent the flowers?   I'd have to be as crazy as she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reyes opens a bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a print out of Lisa's blog. It's sort of a diary she was keeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reyes puts a large pile of papers on Derek's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REYES (cont'd) It's a rather graphic and detailed account of your various sexual liaisons together. D

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can read them for yourself but I should warn you they're a little... X- rated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek pages through, growing more alarmed. We see thing l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is... none of this ever happened. I was never at her apartment. I never even touched her, let alone did any of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to those entries, you're quite the accomplished lover, Mister Charles. And you made promises to her, promises to divorce your wife and marry her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't possibly believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether I believe it or not is irrelevant. The only thing that matters is that she believes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be something I can do to protect myself... my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could file a restraining order.    But that may not be necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa's left town. She was released in the custody of an older sister yesterday. Her sister flew down from San Francisco and took her back. Lisa's agreed to check herself into a neuropsychiatric hospital up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (some relief) Well, I can't say I'm unhappy to hear she's gone. Maybe now she can get the help she needs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W ith any luck, Mister Charles, you'll never hear from her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth moves through the room, stopping to pick up one of Kyle's toys. She looks through the sliding glass window a sees Derek on the deck, holding Kyle in his arms. They're playing a game. Derek points to objects in the distance a Kyle identifies them. "Truck... doggie... bird..." and so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear in Beth's eye.   She comes closer.   They don't se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing to Kyle) "Four little ducks went out one day... over the hill and far away..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few days later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 14 year old baby sitter SAMANTHA walks Beth and Derek t the front door. They're dressed for a night out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got our cell numbers so if there's any problem, don't hesitate to call us, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, honey.     Samantha knows what to do, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got four little brothers.    Trust me. I'm really good at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut Beth remains concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Derek) I don't know. Maybe we should...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. Do you know how hard it was to get these reservations? Come on, we agreed. This is an important night. And I am not gonna waste you in that outfit. (to Samantha) She looks fantastic, doesn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a movie star.

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: erek takes Beth by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving in; to Samantha) Okay, but you call us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek grins and leads her out the door, calls back to Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock this.     We'll be back by ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha closes the door behind them and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Beth sit together in a romantic candle-lit boot working on a bottle of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen you looking this relaxed and beautiful in weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd forgotten what this was like... the two of us out together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.    It's been awhile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her. It's been awhile since they've touched o had sex, too. Beth smiles a little shyly, drops her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) (ENCOURAGED) So... there's hope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek pours the last of the bottle into Beth's glass and signals the Waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK (cont'd) Could we get another bottle, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek smiles at Beth.        She looks at her wine glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, not everybody gets drunk and does things they regret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek looks like he's been punched in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep telling you I didn't do any thing to regret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth looks up and gives him a hard, cold look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am telling you... you did.

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: amantha is sprawled on the couch. The TV is going, she's listening to music on her I-pod while texting a friend on phone and paging through a teen magazine all at the same time, multi-tasking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't hear the door bell RING the first time. Or th second. Then there's a LOUD KNOCKING. Samantha becomes aware, looks around, then sees a shadowy figure through t frosted window next to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a SIGH of annoyance, Samantha gets up and goes to th door. She unlocks and opens it. Lisa is standing on the threshold, looking fresh and pretty and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (super friendly) Hi, I'm Beth's friend Allie.      She's expecting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa breezes right in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister and Mrs. Charles are out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They went to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Beth told me to drop by. That's strange. Oh well, I have something for Kyle. I'll just run up and give it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't.     He's sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I won't wake him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm here right now. Why should I... oh, I see. Just doing your duty. Good girl. You know what, let me call Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa takes out a cell phone, punches in a number.      Sa looks relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) (into her cell) Beth? Hey, girlfriend. It's Allie. Where am I? Where are you! I'm at your place. You told me to come by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to Samantha) No it's okay. She forgot. (back into cell) No, Samantha was a little concerned so I said I'd call you. (winks at Samantha) Yeah. Okay, honey. You two have a great night. (to Samantha; holding out the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, wait. Did you want to talk to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha shakes her head "no."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) (into cell) Beth, I'll call you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa clicks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA (cont'd) (to Samantha) Great. This will only take me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa crosses to the stairs and goes up.      Samantha ret the couch and resumes texting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yle is asleep in his crib. The door cracks open, emitting light from the hall, turning Lisa into a silhouette. She enters the room, silent as a ghost, and approaches Kyle's crib. She stands over him, smiling down at the vulnerable sleeping child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, Lisa turns away and looks at herself in a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out a tube of red lipstick and applies it to he lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha is listening to i-pod music/texting/watching TV. the background, out of focus, Lisa comes down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Samantha.   Nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preoccupied; doesn't even LOOK) You, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa vanishes. Samantha sends a last message, then thinks she ought to check on the baby. She gets up, starts for t stairs when she gets another text message on her phone. S checks it, laughs and returns to the couch to text her fr back.                                                  C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Beth drive home in tense silence.   Finally, Be speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his birthday tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him we'd take him to Legoland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go on-line tonight and order the tickets. Unless you think you should take him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Whatever we're going through, he needs us to be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek turns the corner to their street. The house comes i sight. The garage door goes up. Derek pulls into the driv and guides the car into the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A key in the lock.     The door opens.    Derek and Beth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the couch, Samantha ends her texting and greets them w a bright smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! You guys got back so fast--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any trouble with Kyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  He was a doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you just missed your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Derek freeze, turn and look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. Allie? She was just here... called you on the cell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody called me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone was here?     Inside the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beth) You said it was okay.    She said she had something for Kyle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (instant panic) Oh my god! Where's Kyle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth streaks for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long since she was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple minutes. What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek runs for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA (cont'd) (calling after them; now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it was okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth runs to the crib. To her horror, it's empty. Lisa le out a cry of anguish. Derek appears in the door. Lisa tur to him in desperate panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She took him! She took my baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek tears back down the stairs, shouting to Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call 911!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bursts out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek races into the garage, yanks open the driver's door gets in. He starts the engine, turns to back out and -- Surprise! There's Kyle is in the backseat, strapped into car seat, smiling at his Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek gets out, pulls open the back door and unstraps his son, then hesitates. What Derek sees makes his blood run cold. On the child's forehead... a perfect red lipstick kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is being examined by A DOCTOR while Derek and Beth comfort him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pumped his stomach. X-ray and cat scan came back normal. We'll wait for the blood work but it appears he's completely fine. I don't see any reason why you can't take Bhim home in a couple hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearful relief) Thank you, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monica Reyes appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek and Beth confer with Reyes.       Beth is very agita

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently Lisa stole her sister's ID to buy a ticket and board a plane to LA earlier today, then used her sister's credit card to rent a car. The sister didn't even know she was gone until a few hours ago. She said Lisa had been doing well in therapy. She didn't know she checked herself out this morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was in our house -- alone with our son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he doctor says he's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not fine. to Reyes; demanding) I want you to find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will. She violated the restraining order so we can arrest her. Look, Mrs. Charles, I know you're upset. I'm a mother, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you feel if it was your child?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly the same as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes back into the examining room to join Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what? Am I supposed to go out and buy a gun or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't physically harm him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but she could have. Is that the message she's trying to send?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either that or...maybe she was trying to show you she could love him. off Derek's sickened reaction) People like Lisa... their emotions can turn on a dime. What you don't want is her feelings for you to change to rage. I don't know. But there's a good chance she'll try to get in touch. If she does, you need to call me right away. Meanwhile, you might want to beef up your home security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: erek nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV pulls up and parks. Derek and Beth get out. Derek removes the sleeping Kyle from his car seat and carries h to the front door where Beth waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is asleep as Derek tucks him in.    Beth CRIES OUT f another part of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek races out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom has been trashed. The bed has been stripped. The ceiling mirror is now a spider-webs of cracks.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The closet is open and clothes are strewn about. Derek discovers Beth on her knees, holding up a family photogra in which Beth's head has been torn off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never left.   She was here the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth scrambles over and finds a wedding photo of herself Derek. Again, her head has been removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ETH (cont'd) What kind of sick person...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek crouches down and holds Beth who begins to cry, her body shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, it's all right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Derek! It's not all right!!! We have to do something. We can't live like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he holds his wife, Derek looks up and sees their reflection in the mirror -- twisted and distorted, like Lisa's mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Kyle watch Baby Einstein on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., A SECURITY MAN installs a new alarm system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth is on the phone, talking to someone.   Derek keeps a on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Right. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth clicks off, starts dialing a new number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got her home number from Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can still pick up her messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want her to know who she's dealing with now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other end, Lisa's cheerful voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, this is Lisa. I'm not here right now so please leave a message after the beep and I'll get back to you. Have a good one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) L isten to me, you little bitch. This is Beth Charles and I just want you to know that if you ever... ever... come near my child or my house again... I'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth clicks off, gives Derek a defiant look.       Derek know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security Man appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all set, folks. You want me to show you how the system works?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek lies in bed, wide awake, on guard. He hears a car engine outside, gets up and goes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek looks out and sees a police patrol car in front of house. A moment later, it drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek goes to Kyle's room. He's sleeping safely. He goes the master bedroom and observes Beth from the door way. She's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek returns to the guest room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden SOUND.     Derek tenses.   He hops up and goes t window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the sprinklers going on in the front yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is leaving for work.     He points to the security

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you set this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't go on much longer. They're bound to pick her up soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if you want me to stay, I'll call in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Go to work. If anything happens, the security patrol can be here in two minutes. (off his look) Go. I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek opens the door and exits.      Beth closes it behin then touches the keypad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth watches from the window as Derek drives off to work. Kyle is nearby playing. The phone rings. Beth goes over a picks it up, a little wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Oh hi, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she listens with mounting concern, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick is at his desk.    The phone buzzes and he picks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek Charles' office.      Oh, hi, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick perks up at the tone in Beth's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek is concentrating at his desk when his phone BUZZES. answers quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth's on 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.     Hi, honey.   Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle is playing on the floor.      Beth is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine but I had some not so great news from my Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom went back in for more tests. They wanted to do another biopsy and she's pretty scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can imagine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it'll be fine but I thought I'd drive down to San Diego to hold her hand, take Kyle with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be stuck here pretty late but I could drive down after...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's a good idea. Friday night traffic's gonna be a nightmare and they won't know the results til tomorrow. Why don't you do what you need to do and drive down in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: here's still that frostiness between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Say hi to your dad and tell your mom everything's going to be fine, I love her. And call me when you're leaving the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth clicks off and turns to Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Come on, sweetie. We're gonna take a little trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legoland?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth almost laughs.    She holds him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much more fun than Legoland.     We're going down to Nana and Poppa's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We'll see Daddy tomorrow.     Now... what toys do you want to take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle toddles over to his toy box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At his desk, Patrick answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek Charles' office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bright and chipper) Hey there, girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy to hear from her; keeps his voice down) L isa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you, too. Everything okay around the office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed/secretive) Well, actually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little concerned. I heard the Charles' took out a restraining order against you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHS) Oh, that. That was Beth's doing. She's not handling this very well. Derek's just waiting for the right time to tell her he's leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I should be telling you this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick, don't be such a drama queen.   I thought we were friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are, we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Beth's headed down to San Diego tonight. Her mother is having some tests done. Derek is driving down first thing in the morning to be by her side. when she doesn't respond) Lisa? Did you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick, I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I wanted to tell you about my date I last night. The one my friend set me up with? The graphic artist? Lisa, you'd be so proud of me. I met him for drinks at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't care whose dick you sucked last night. I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Patrick looks like he's been hit in the face with a of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her cell phone in her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IDEN TO REVEAL that she's standing in a grove of trees, looking down at the Charles house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes out the front door, arms full with Kyle and overnight bags. She sets the alarm and shuts the door beh her... only to realize she forgot her purse. Beth punches back in, grabs the purse from inside and closes the front door again behind her. Forgets to re-set the alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth secures Kyle in his kiddie seat, then walks around t the driver's side, gets in and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN UP TO Lisa watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa approaches the back of the house, carrying a paper b She steps up on the deck and goes to the kitchen door. Sh doesn't even check to see if it's locked. She takes the b which contains a bottle of champagne and uses the bottle break a pane in the kitchen door window. Then she reaches inside and unlocks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa steps inside and looks around at the cheerful room, Kyle's high chair, the places set for three at the table.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: isa puts the champagne bottle on the counter, then hummin happily, she begins to open shelves until she finds two crystal champagne flutes. She takes them down. Now she looks for an ice bucket and finds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth drives down the hill, calling Derek on her cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering his cell) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just left the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.    Did you set the alarm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The... I think I did. I had to run back in and I can't remember if I re-set it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm barely down the hill.     I'll do it and call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth clicks off. She slows down and pulls into a driveway She backs out and returns up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa enters, carrying the ice bucket with the champagne bottle in it and the two flutes. She smiles excitedly, li a woman preparing for her lover's return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa places the champagne on the night table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She removes her coat to reveal a sexy white nightgown, th reaches into the coat pocket and takes out a paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he upends the bag and with a giggle, begins to sprinkle r rose petals on the floor, making a trail to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth drives up the winding road to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ice bucket and champagne sit on the night table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa stretches out on the bed, amid the rose petals, leav a space for her lover beside her. She gazes up at the cracked ceiling mirror. She smiles at herself and, thanks the cracked mirror, her smile is distorted, scary and ins looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth pulls into the drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bed, Lisa hears the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rolls off the bed and crosses to the window, parting curtains to look out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stepping out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible; to Kyle) Mommy will just be a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa tenses, suddenly fearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't work, glancing at his cell for Beth's call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth lets herself in. She's about to set the alarm when s hears the floor creak above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth freezes.    She waits, listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No further sound.    But Beth knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes to the front door as if to leave. She opens the door and closes it as if she left the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa, standing very still near the window, hears the soun the door opening downstairs, then closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved, she moves to the window and peers out, expectin see Beth getting into the car. But there's no sight of he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth pulls off her shoes and lays them by the door. She begins to quietly tip toe up the stairs, certain to be as quiet as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth enters to see Lisa peering out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, you're even dumber than my husband said you were. (BEAT) Or did you just forget to take your meds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa whirls around. Beth is standing in the doorway, givi Lisa a deadly look, like a cat who's just trapped a mouse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth takes notice of the rose petals on the bed and floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is wide-eyed, terrified, caught. Lisa begins to edge way around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) You really fucked up this time... coming back to my house. Didn't you get my message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa's eyes dart around for escape.   Beth seems remarkab calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) You can look all you want but you're not getting out of here. ot until I've given you the beating of your life... bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she means it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa tries to dart around her. But Beth cuts her off, grabbing Lisa by the throat and forcing her back, slammin her hard against the bed post.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: isa bounces off the post, stunned. Beth is on her, slappi her hard, grabbing a handful of Lisa's hair, ripping it o by the roots as Lisa tries to get free. Lisa lets out a subhuman shriek of pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth tosses the hank of hair aside, keeps on coming.    S beyond pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Think you can walk into my house... my bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth slaps and punches Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) My child... my husband!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa tries to fight back but Beth is a tiger, beating the hell out of her, knocking her around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain; terrified,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please?   Please what?   Please don't hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Beth pummels her, Lisa stumbles/retreats into the adjoining bathroom. She slams the door shut and throws th lock, face bleeding, looking around for a weapon, somethi to protect herself with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH!   The bathroom door comes off its hinges as Beth b in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth grabs Lisa by the head and slams her face into the bathroom mirror. It cracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa is wobbly, unable to stand. Her face is a bloody mes But before she can collapse, Beth props her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're bleeding. We need to wash that off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth forces Lisa down, shoves her head into the toilet an flushes it, holding her there as Lisa flops and chokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Don't worry. I'm not going to drown you. jerking Lisa's head up) No, no. I'm just getting started...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late, bitch.   Sorry won't cut it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth kicks Lisa out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa lands on the floor and gets up, rose petals sticking her gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Beth comes out of the bathroom, Lisa lunges for the ni table and grabs the bottle of champagne. She swings it an hits Beth is the side of the head. Whack! The cork pops a champagne goes spewing everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, Beth goes down on her knees. Lisa wipes blood fr her face, circling Beth, lips drawn back and teeth showin like an animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't love you! I'm the one he wants! (crazed; screaming) Why can't you get that through your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa raises the bottle to hit her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth lunges forward and tackles her. The bottle goes flyi as the two women thrash around on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek dials Beth's cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle snoozes in his car seat. Inside Beth's hand bag on t front seat, her cell phone TRILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Lisa fight on the floor like two she-demons.   L breaks free from Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crawls to the head of the stairs and grabs the post, pulling herself to her feet, eager to escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly behind her) Careful. You don't want to fall down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth gives Lisa a shove. Lisa goes crashing down the stai and lands at the bottom in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH (cont'd) Did that hurt? Because it looked real painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (managing to sit up; defensive) Please... Beth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's Beth now?    What happened to Betty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa rises to her feet, wobbly.       She raises bloody h surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I'll go... I'll leave... I swear I'll never bother you again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa turns and desperately hobbles for the front door. Bu Beth easily beats her to it, knocking Lisa aside and thro the chain.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: eth turns and faces Lisa with a murderous look. Hugging t wall for support Lisa back away, leaving a bloody smear. Beth advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen, the phone RINGS.       Both women freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hone RINGS again.    Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, you've reached the Charles residence. We're not here right now but if you have a message for Derek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... or Beth... or Kyle.... Kyle, say hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please wait for the beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with concern) Beth? Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa tries to make it to the kitchen to get the phone. Be grabs her by the sleeve and pulls her back. The sleeve te loose in Beth's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa stumbles back toward the stairs. She scrambles upwar thinking maybe she can get to the phone in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa reaches the top step just as Beth snags her ankle, stopping her. Lisa rolls around and viciously kicks Beth the shoulder with her other leg. Beth falls back, tumbles halfway down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EREK'S VOICE (cont'd) Beth, pick up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa makes it to the bedroom.   She sees the phone on the night stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK'S VOICE (cont'd) Beth?    Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa desperately grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek!    Oh, Derek, thank god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reacting in surprise and panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she can answer, Beth is suddenly there. She rips t phone from Lisa's hand and strikes her with it. As Lisa stumbles back into the hall landing, Beth speaks calmly, sweetly, into the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek, I'm right in the middle of something... let me call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarmed, Derek hurries out of the office, punching a numb into his cell as he runs to the elevator. A nervous Patri watches Derek exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EREK (cont'd) I need to speak to Lt. Reyes.   It's an emergency!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth goes out into the hall and Lisa springs on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he two women fight, going up against the bannister. They claw and punch at each other. With renewed strength, Lisa forces Beth up against the bannister. Beth looks over the side and down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen feet below is that large glass dining table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa bangs Beth against the bannister. A few feet away is heavy crystal chandelier suspended from the ceiling by a metal chain.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he bannister rail begins to crack. Lisa tries to force Be over, then Beth suddenly swings them around, reversing positions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bannister cracks, breaks apart and Lisa topples over side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she's about to fall, Lisa reaches out and grabs the chandelier with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By a miracle, it supports her and she swings back and for like a human pendulum but now the chandelier is beginning pull loose from it's ceiling mount. Plaster cracks and ri away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa swings back and forth, dangling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stands on the landing. She looks at terrified Lisa, then up at the ceiling mount. It won't take Lisa's weight much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And both women know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa hangs by one hand, reaching out with her other hand Beth who could pull her to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth considers. Then, as if coming out of dream, she slow reaches out to Lisa. Their hands lock together. Beth slow pulls Lisa toward her, toward safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet voice) Let go of the chandelier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AFRAID) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go, Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he chandelier is about to break loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ETH (cont'd) (motherly concern) Listen to me. You have to let go right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, trusting, Lisa lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But so does Beth!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a look of horror on her face, Lisa falls through spa The soundtrack goes dead silent as we go into slow motion

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down, down, down Lisa falls. Her arms and legs flop aroun like a marionette with its strings cut, clawing the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fall seems endless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... Lisa hits the glass dining table with her back. whole body buckles. The surface of the table ripples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In slow mo, the glass shatters and explodes around Lisa, framing her entire body, forming a halo around her head. Sound returns -- the sound of breaking glass -- and it's deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The table gives way and Lisa lands hard on the marble flo her skull cracking. Her back is probably broken but she's still conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ying there, Lisa stares up at Beth on the landing as glas bounces and TINKLES around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two enemies lock eyes.   Beth's face is impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa opens her mouth, trying to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when the chandelier breaks loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth watches without emotion as the chandelier plunges downward and hits Lisa in the chest with a radiantly beautiful shower of crystals. It kills her on impact.

dialogues.speaker: W
dialogues.text: e come out of slow motion.   Real time resumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the landing, Beth stares down at Lisa's body, splayed under the chandelier like a broken doll. Lisa's eyes are open but they're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, stoic, just stands there, looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Derek speeds through traffic, desperate to get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes down the stairs, taking no notice of Lisa's lifeless body. She goes to the foyer, unhooks the chain a opens the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, a car pulls up and Monica Reyes jumps out. Reyes hurries up the walk and meets Beth standing in the open d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?    Is everything alright here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very calm) I'm fine. Lisa had an accident. (moving past Reyes) I have to go. My mother needs me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reyes looks into the house and sees Lisa's body, then tur back as Beth goes to her car and opens the driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, I need to speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth turns back to Reyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me on my cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you know what happened... (a beat) ORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH(cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now my child has been waiting too long. I am sure my husband will be home soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Reyes lock eyes. Reyes nods her understanding. B nods back, gets in the car, starts the engine and backs o of the drive. Reyes watches her exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In traffic.    He dials his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up her ringing cell phone, looks at the caller and glances at Kyle in the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears start to well) It's Daddy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, I spoke to Reyes.   Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Derek--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth... (a pause) Tell me baby-- are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have believed you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay, honey.     We're gonna be okay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long beat) I love you, Derek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I love you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek continues on against the traffic. The dashboard picture of Beth and Kyle still smiling back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Beth's car drives away, passing police cars on their w to the house.
